entry.title: Best Paper Award at the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track

link.title: Best Paper Award at the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track

entry.content:
Our paper ‚ÄúAdaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines‚Äù presented in the SPLC22 Research Track has received the Best Paper Award!

Best research paper award @splcconf #SPLC2022

Adaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines
by Shaghayegh Tavassoli, Carlos Diego Damasceno, Ramtin Khosravi and Mohammadreza Mousav@damascenodiego @smr_mousavi Track co-chair @wesleyklewerton pic.twitter.com/GmbBQKLhSy

— Jabier Martinez (@jabier_lab) September 16, 2022

Great news! We received the best paper award at @splcconf #splc22

Thanks again Shaghayegh @smr_mousavi Ramtin ü•≥üèÜ pic.twitter.com/05W6unbT2C

— Diego Damasceno (@damascenodiego) September 16, 2022
entry.summary: Our paper ‚ÄúAdaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines‚Äù presented in the SPLC22 Research Track has received the Best Paper Award!

entry.title: Paper published in the Festschrift dedicated to Frits Vaandrager‚Äôs 60th birthday

link.title: Paper published in the Festschrift dedicated to Frits Vaandrager‚Äôs 60th birthday

entry.content:
In collaboration with Daniel Struber, we proposed the idea of ‚Äúfamily-based fingerprinting‚Äù, an approach that combines product-line, security and model learning principles to analyze behavioral signatures from software variants.

A position paper discussing this idea was published in the book dedicated to Frits Vaandrager on the occasion of his 60th birthday. A preprint is available in my Publications page. The complete proceedings is available at Springer.

Official release and celebration of the book dedicated to Frits Vaandrager on the occasion of his 60th birthday. pic.twitter.com/i0Zfbdbyjn

— Diego Damasceno (@damascenodiego) September 23, 2022
entry.summary: In collaboration with Daniel Struber, we proposed the idea of ‚Äúfamily-based fingerprinting‚Äù, an approach that combines product-line, security and model learning principles to analyze behavioral signatures from software variants.

entry.title: MDE Artifacts has been featured in the blog Modeling-Languages

link.title: MDE Artifacts has been featured in the blog Modeling-Languages

entry.content:
Our recent MoDELS‚Äô21 paper has been featured at [[https://modeling-languages.com/guidelines-for-quality-management-of-research-artifacts-in-model-driven-engineering/ | MOdelling LAnguages]], the most popular vendor-independent blog on modeling and model-driven engineering.

Recently, @danstrueb and I were invited to write an article about our @modelsconf paper on the blog https://t.co/TIqIOJIqUd.

The article is finally online.

I hope you enjoy it! :)https://t.co/ZKBDJPPT5W

— Diego Damasceno (@damascenodiego) July 5, 2022
entry.summary: Our recent MoDELS‚Äô21 paper has been featured at [[https://modeling-languages.com/guidelines-for-quality-management-of-research-artifacts-in-model-driven-engineering/ | MOdelling LAnguages]], the most popular vendor-independent blog on modeling and model-driven engineering.

entry.title: Tool Paper accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Tool Track

link.title: Tool Paper accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Tool Track

entry.content:
I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúA Tool for Analysing Higher-Order Feature Interactions in Preprocessor Annotations in C and C++ Projects‚Äù has been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Tool Track. This paper is the result of a research internship of David Korsmann, a Master‚Äôs student at Radbod University. A preprint is available in my Publications page.

Happy to have received two more notifications of accepted papers at @splcconf! ü•≥

One in the Artifact track; this co-authored with @smr_mousavi Shaghayegh Tavassoli and Ramtin Khosravi

Other in the Demo and Tools Track; this co-authored with David Korsman and @danstrueb

— Diego Damasceno (@damascenodiego) July 4, 2022
entry.summary: I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúA Tool for Analysing Higher-Order Feature Interactions in Preprocessor Annotations in C and C++ Projects‚Äù has been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Tool Track. This paper is the result of a research internship of David Korsmann, a Master‚Äôs student at Radbod University. A preprint is available in my Publications page.

entry.title: Paper and artifact accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track

link.title: Paper and artifact accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track

entry.content:
I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúAdaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines‚Äù and the artifact submission associated to it have been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track. This paper is the result of a collaboration with Shaghayegh Tavassoli, Mohammad Mousavi, and Ramtin Khosravi. A preprint is available in my Publications page.

Delighted to learn that our paper on "Adaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines" with Shaghayegh Tavassoli, @damascenodiego, and Ramtin Khosravi is accepted at @splcconf .
Will post a pre-print on my page; drop me a line, if you would like a sneak peek. https://t.co/waMcg4oAqR

— Mohammad Mousavi (@smr_mousavi) June 3, 2022
entry.summary: I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúAdaptive Behavioral Model Learning for Software Product Lines‚Äù and the artifact submission associated to it have been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Research Track. This paper is the result of a collaboration with Shaghayegh Tavassoli, Mohammad Mousavi, and Ramtin Khosravi. A preprint is available in my Publications page.

entry.title: Paper accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Challenge Track

link.title: Paper accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Challenge Track

entry.content:
I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúA Dataset for Active Learning of Variability-Intensive Systems‚Äù has been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Challenge Track. This paper is the result of a collaboration with Shaghayegh Tavassoli, Mohammad Mousavi, and Ramtin Khosravi. A preprint is available in my Publications page.

We are happy to share that our paper "A Dataset for Active Learning of Variability-Intensive Systems" has been accepted in the Challenge Cases Track of the @splcconf 2022!

This paper is a collaboration with Shaghayegh Tavassoli, @damascenodiego @smr_mousavi, and Ramtin Khosravi pic.twitter.com/kcj7wNG1cX

— Diego Damasceno (@damascenodiego) February 28, 2022
entry.summary: I am happy to announce that the paper ‚ÄúA Dataset for Active Learning of Variability-Intensive Systems‚Äù has been accepted in the SPLC‚Äô22 - Challenge Track. entry.title: Earned the degree of MBA in Project Management

link.title: Earned the degree of MBA in Project Management

entry.content:
After two years of a lot of learning, today I am completing my Master of Business Administration (MBA) in Project Management at the ‚ÄúLuiz de Queiroz‚Äù School of Agriculture (USP/ESALQ - S√£o Paulo). üë®üèæ‚Äçüéì

The course covered more than 60 modules that showed me a new world of problems that I am eager to explore in the next comming years. This course definitely made me to rethink my ideal of scientific research of quality and how quality of research artifacts can be addressed! ‚ú®

For more information about the school where I attended this MBA, please check their website at https://mbauspesalq.com/.

A preprint of my final year project is avaliable in my publications page.
entry.summary: After two years of a lot of learning, today I am completing my Master of Business Administration (MBA) in Project Management at the ‚ÄúLuiz de Queiroz‚Äù School of Agriculture (USP/ESALQ - S√£o Paulo). üë®üèæ‚Äçüéì

entry.title: Invited speaker at the SNCT-IFMa‚Äô21
entry.content:
In October 29th, I was an invited speaker at the National Week of Science and Technology of the Federal Institute of Education, Science and Technology of Maranh√£o (in portuguese, Semana Nacional de Ci√™ncia e Tecnologia - SNCT/IFMA).

In this event, I presented the talk
‚ÄúSustentabilidade de Software e Gest√£o de Dados de Pesquisa Cient√≠fica‚Äù where I cover the basic of research artifacts, the benefits of artifact sharing, the lifecycle of research data, and the challenges of discussing artifact quality. The talk was given in portuguese (pt-BR).

The video recording of this talk is available on youtube.
entry.summary: In October 29th, I was an invited speaker at the National Week of Science and Technology of the Federal Institute of Education, Science and Technology of Maranh√£o (in portuguese, Semana Nacional de Ci√™ncia e Tecnologia - SNCT/IFMA).
